intro: Phacelia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, ovate leaves with distinct serrations along the edges. Phacelia denticulata is often used in wildflower gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
